alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 4:11AM PST until March 12 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow with periods of heavy rain expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches below 5500 feet, and up to 10 inches elsewhere, except 8 to 20 inches west of Highway 395. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very strong winds combined with heavy snow accumulations could cause tree damage and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will drop to 4000-5000 feet tonight into Saturday. Periods of higher snow levels could bring the risk of flooding in lower elevations, see the Flood Advisory for more details. Damaging winds are also possible today along the Highway 395 corridor.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
